forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers after 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 2 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock edges into the early morning, Downtown San Francisco lies shrouded in tranquility, with the distant glow of city lights punctuating the overcast sky. A gentle whisper of rain may dance lightly on rooftops as the day unfolds, suggesting that umbrellas might be a wise companion later on. With temperatures hovering near a mild 52 degrees, the air carries an expectation of moisture, yet it feels soft against the skin, inviting a comforting layer to fend off the chill.

Throughout Thursday, an increasing likelihood of rain showers will fill the atmosphere with a refreshing embrace, promising a high of around 60 degrees that will gradually soften to the mid-fifties by midday. The ever-present marine layer lingers, a whisper of fog hugging the coastline, with hints of clarity teasing glimpses of the enchanting Bay, especially during fleeting moments when the sun endeavors to break free. Dress in light layers to navigate this dynamic day—perhaps a warm jacket coupled with a scarf, as the west-southwest winds stir gently, adding a playful chill. As you traverse the streets, consider indulging in a leisurely morning coffee while watching the world awaken, or perhaps visit a local bookstore, where the scent of old pages mingles with the promise of new adventures. Wander through the city’s embrace, letting the rhythmic patter of raindrops guide your thoughts and inspire quiet reflection.
